bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Allowing the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change
to a permanent password is outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

To affectively use password-based authentication, configuring an
indentity provider is required. Documentation on supported authentication providers
can be found in the OpenShift product documentation:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/authentication/understanding-identity-provider.html

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
The certificates used for in-cluster mTLS authentication
are issued by an internal CA. It is not possible
to set a different CA:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/security/certificate_types_descriptions/control-plane-certificates.html

The API server's certificates can be swapped for user-provided
ones:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/security/certificate_types_descriptions/user-provided-certificates-for-api-server.html

It is also possible to set a custom CA for the Proxy objects:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/security/certificate_types_descriptions/proxy-certificates.html
services:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.6/security/certificate_types_descriptions/service-ca-certificates.html

When setting up IDPs, all compliant IDP allow the CA that signed
the IDP certificate to be set:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/rest_api/config_apis/oauth-config-openshift-io-v1.html

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Most of the private keys are stored in Kubernetes secrets
which are inherently protected by the combination of RBAC
and namespaces.

In addition, OpenShift makes use of a number of key files as part
of the operation of its components. This includes keys for control
place components like kube-apiserver, kube-controller-manager,
kube-scheduler and etcd. These key files are protected using
traditional UNIX permissions as well as SELinux labels. Private
keys on the filesystem are checked using CaC rules that will be
imported from the CIS profile. It is possible to check their
permissions and SELinux labels by running:
$ find /etc/kubernetes/static-pod-resources/ -name \*.key -exec ls -lZ {} \;

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
The customer is responsible for checking that no wildcard
certificates are being used.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
There seems to be a gap where the certificates for IDPs are
not checked using OCSP or CRLS:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CMP-977

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational requirements that the registration process to
receive organization-defined types of and/or specific authenticators
be conducted either in person and/or by a trusted third party before
organization-defined registration authority with authorization by
organization-defined personnel or roles is outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Checking password complexity should be set on the IDP side.
The use of the htpasswd-based IDP is not allowed.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
This is an organizational procedural requirement
outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Ensuring  that unencrypted static authenticators are not embedded
in applications or access scripts or stored on function keys, is
an organizational procedural requirement outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

Some general guidance can be provided for Kubernetes Secrets and
private PKI keys stored on the filesystem.

The private PKI keys are only protected by a combination of UNIX
permissions and SELinux labels, but otherwise they are stored
unencrypted on the filesystem.

Regarding Kubernetes secrets, as a general rule, it is recommended
to check all Kubernetes manifests (typically YAML files) and
ensure that no secrets are embedded there. Likewise, the manifests
should not use Kubernetes secret objects as environment variables
to avoid e.g. leaking them when the whole environment is printed
during debugging.

Kubernetes supports secrets as first-class objects, but care
needs to be taken to ensure that access to secrets is carefully
limited. Using an external secrets provider can ease the management
of access to secrets, especially where secrets are used across
both Kubernetes and non-Kubernetes environments.

Encrypting the etcd database ensures that secrets along with the
rest of the database is encrypted at rest.

It might be prudent to consider the use of an external secrets
storage and management system, instead of using Kubernetes
Secrets directly, if you have more complex secret management
needs. Ensure the solution requires authentication to access
secrets, has auditing of access to and use of secrets, and encrypts
secrets. Some solutions also make it easier to rotate secrets.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational implementation of organization-defined security
safeguards to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having
accounts on multiple information systems is outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Employment of mechanisms that satisfy organization-defined
token quality requirements is outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
A control response is planned. Engineering progress can be tracked via:

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CMP-331

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Red Hat OpenShift inherently meets this as the session key and account login
passwords are obscured by not being displayed on output or by asterisks.
This control is inherently met.

This is applicable to both the `oc` CLI and OpenShift's UI console.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
FIPS mode can be enabled in OpenShift through a flag that
can be set at installation time [1]. Follow the relevant
documentation for the applicable cloud provider [2][3][4][5]
for more information. But note that this is also applicable
in on-prem deployments.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/installing/installing-fips.html
[2] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/installing/installing_aws/installing-aws-government-region.html#installation-configuration-parameters_installing-aws-government-region
[3] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/installing/installing_azure/installing-azure-customizations.html
[4] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/installing/installing_gcp/installing-gcp-customizations.html

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Checking media containing diagnostic and test programs for
malicious code before the media are used in the information
system is outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Preventing the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing
organizational information by verifying that there is no organizational
information contained on the equipment is outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Preventing the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing
organizational information by sanitizing or destroying the equipment is
outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Preventing the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing
organizational information by retaining the equipment within the
facility is outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Preventing the unauthorized removal of maintenance equipment containing
organizational information by obtaining an exception from
organization-defined personnel or roles explicity authorizing removal
of the equipment from the facility is outside the scope of OpenShift
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Approving and monitoring nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities is an
organizational control outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Allowing the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only as consistent with
organizational policy and documented in the security plan for the information system is an
orgnaizational control outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Red Hat OpenShift does not have special maintenance or diagnostics
accounts or login procedures except for backup and restore
of the etcd database which requires ssh access:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/backup_and_restore/disaster_recovery/scenario-2-restoring-cluster-state.html
For ssh access, the only permitted authenticator are ssh keys provided
via MachineConfig objects.

Similarly to what is being suggested in the AC control family,
it is recommended to grant the cluster-admin clusterrole
to a user or a group backed by an IDP and subsequently
remove the kubeadmin user as described in https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/authentication/remove-kubeadmin.html

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
The maintaining of records for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities is an
orgnaizational control outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Red Hat OpenShift does not have special maintenance or diagnostics
accounts or login procedures.

Similarly to what is being suggested in the AC control family,
it is recommended to grant the cluster-admin clusterrole
to a user or a group backed by an IDP and subsequently
remove the kubeadmin user as described in https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/authentication/remove-kubeadmin.html

With that, any login session can be terminated by removing the
appropriate "oauthaccesstoken" API object.

When restoring the etcd database, the RHCOS hosts need to be configured
to terminate idle sessions.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Establishing a process for maintenance personnel authorization and
maintaining a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel
is outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Ensuring that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance on

outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Designating organizational personnel with required access
authorizations and technical competence to supervise the
maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess
the required access authorizations is outside the
scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:

personnel that lack appropriate security clearances or are not U.S.
citizens is outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Development and implementation of alternate security safeguards
in the event an information system component cannot be sanitized,
removed, or disconnected from the system, is outside the scope
of OpenShift configuration.

and environmental protection policy reflects organizational
procedure/policy and is not applicable to component-level
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational review and updates to the physical and
environmental protection policy reflects organizational
procedure/policy and is not applicable to component-level
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Development, approval, and maintenance of a list
of individuals with authorized access to the facility
where the information system resides reflects organizational
procedure/policy and is not applicable to component-level
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Issuing authorization credentials for facility access
reflects organizational procedure/policy and is not
applicable to component-level configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Reviewing the access list detailing authorized facility
access by individuals at an organization-defined frequency
reflects organizational procedure/policy and is not
applicable to component-level configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Removal of individuals from the facility access list when access
is no longer required reflects organizational procedure/policy
and is not applicable to component-level configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Enforcing physical access authorizations at organization-defined
entry/exit points to the facility where the information system resides
reflects organizational procedure/policy and is not applicable to
component-level configuration.

configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes to rescreen individuals according to
organization-defined conditions requiring rescreening and,
where rescreening is so indicated, the frequency of such
rescreening, is outside the scope of OpenShift
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that individuals accessing an
information system processing, storing, or transmitting information
requiring special protection have valid access authorizations that are
demonstrated by assigned official government dutues, are outside the
scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that individuals accessing an
information system processing, storing, or transmitting information
requiring special protection satisgy organization-defined additional
personnel screening criteria, are outside the scope of OpenShift
configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, information system access is disabled within an
organization-defined time period, are outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, any authenticators/credentials associated with the individual
are terminated/revoked, are outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, exit interviews are conducted that include a discussion of
organization-defined information security topics, are outside the scope
of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, all security-related organizational information
system-related property is retrieved, are outside the scope
of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, the organization retains access to organizational
information systems formerly controlled by the terminated individual,
are outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes ensuring that, upon termination of individual
employment, the organization notifies organization-defined personnel
or roles within an organization-defined time period, are outside
the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational employment of automated mechanisms to notify
organization-defined personnel or roles upon termination of
an individual, is outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes to review and confirm ongoing operational
need for current logical and physical access authorizations to
information systems/facilities when individuals are reassigned or
transferred to other positions within the organization are
outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes to initiate organization-defined transfer
or reassignment actions within organization-defined time period
following the formal transfer action are outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational processes to modify access authorizations as needed to
correspond with any changes in oeprational need due to reassignment
or transfer are outside the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational notifications of organization-defined personnel
or roles within an organization-defined time period are outside
the scope of OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Organizational process to develop and document access agreements for
organizational information systems are outside the scope of
OpenShift configuration.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
The Compliance Operator [1] scans the host and the platform (OCP)
configuration for software flaws and improper configurations according
to different compliance benchmarks. It uses OpenSCAP as a backend,
which is a known and certified tool to do such scans.

The default results are presented by the operator in the form of
ComplianceCheckResults, which are Kubernetes objects. These objects
are labeled with the appropriate severity of the finding.

It is also possible to download the raw results which contain
information such as the risk score.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/security/compliance_operator/compliance-operator-understanding.html#compliance-operator-understanding

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CMP-352

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.

applicable to the configuration of OpenShift.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
The Compliance Operator [1] scans the host and the platform (OCP)
configuration for software flaws and improper configurations according
to different compliance benchmarks. It uses OpenSCAP as a backend,
which is a known and certified tool to do such scans.

The system presents remediations as ComplianceRemediation objects,
which are Kubernetes objects stored in Etcd. These can be applied
to remediate findings per organizational policy.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/security/compliance_operator/compliance-operator-understanding.html#compliance-operator-understanding

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CMP-352

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
For the purpose of conducting a vulnerability scan of OpenShift, the OpenShift API and nodes
should be scanned using the OpenShift Compliance Operator. OpenShift supports
RBAC for users and groups, appropriate vulnerability scans can be performed against
the OpenShift web application interface. For the OpenShift Compliance Operator, only OpenShift
Cluster Administators are able to access and run the operator for compliance and vulnerability scans.

Finally, everything is open source:
  https://github.com/openshift/

Therefore this control is addressed via documentation.

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/installing/installing_bare_metal/installing-bare-metal-network-customizations.html#installation-network-user-infra_installing-bare-metal-network-customizations

Therefore this control is addressed via documentation.

As part of the compliance checks performed by the Compliance Operator,
Red Hat OpenShift components such as the kubelet are checked for using
TLS and communicating only on the approved ports.

To facilitate a response, links to Red Hat OpenShift documentation

as well as Chapter 3 (Container Security) of the OpenShift
security guide.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:

documentation applies here.
The following chapters provides an overview of securing the container content
and the build process:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/security/container_security/security-container-content.html
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.7/security/container_security/security-build.html

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:

system services is an organization policy and procedure control
that is out of scope for OpenShift configuration

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Red Hat uses git and github for development, so all changes including
their authorship are tracked in SCMs and identifiable with a hash.
Any downstream-specific changes are tracked in a special "midstream"
repository. This makes the control inherently met.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Red Hat uses git and github for development, so all changes including
their authorship are tracked in SCMs and identifiable with a hash.
Any downstream-specific changes are tracked in a special "midstream"
repository.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
All commits to repositories must be peer-reviewed. In addition,
changes are tracked in Jira where every Epic must be signed off.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Each individual change goes through a peer review. Larger, system-wide
changes are tracked with a PR against the enhancements repository
(https://github.com/openshift/enhancements/). Each change tracked in
Jira also requires a signoff by the documentation team.

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
Official Red Hat CVE findings can be found at:
https://access.redhat.com/security/security-updates/#/cve

bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.description: Describe how is the software component satisfying the control.
bdba9d56-2be4-498d-8d31-b43cab6a44bd.remarks:
All containers comprising the OpenShift Container Platform are
signed and from an authorized registry. Signature verification is
done in the Container Runtime level before running the containers.
Therefore, the OpenShift Platform inherently meets this control.
